history.content: I suggest you talk directly with your major advisor in Engineering Science and ask about the process. I went through the same process for the math major and theirs were super informal. I basically email the professor in charge of approving such things and attached my transcript and other proofs. Then he emailed me back his approval and cc'd my major advisor and that was it.

children.subject: 1, 2 and 3 depends on your major advisor. Do whatever they say and show whatever documents they ask if, particularly if you have coursework outside of Cal.

Got it! To clarify, you mean my Major advisor, not my College advisor, right?

Also, how can I get a hold of my advisor given that it is currently Winter Break? Do they answer emails during the holidays?

Ok, thanks Anonymous Calc!

A few follow-ups:

1.) Is there an actual 'petition' I need though? How long did the process also take for you?

2.) You mentioned "proofs" you sent the Professor; what are these "proofs"?

3.) Does this process differ for people in the COE? (COE students, feel free to comment)

history.content:
Hi!

In the College of Engineering, how would one go about substituting a major requirement with another course? I want to substitute a major requirement with another course for Spring 2022 and I have a few questions:

1.) I know that I would need to petition, but what exactly does this course substitution petition process look like? How do I access this petition?

2.) Would it be too late to submit a petition for Spring 2022? If anyone has any insight into how long this petition process usually takes, please let me know.

3.) This post is regarding the substitution of one of the required upper-division courses for my major (an upper-div lab course for another upper-div lab course). Additionally, outside of this, could I also substitute a lower-division major requirement for an upper-division course? 

4.) Anything else I should know about the process?

Note: I am not an EECS major; I am in Engineering Science. 

Any and all advice would be greatly appreciated. Thanks!
history.subject: Substitution for a Required Course (Spring 2022)
